FOUND IN: Verona - referencing Shakespeare's "Romeo and Juliet" without directly stating two gentlemen, but they are central characters.
Mariinsky Ballet (Company) - A world-renowned ballet company based in Saint Petersburg, known as the Kirov Ballet until 2013.
Sepia - A natural brown to reddish-brown pigment obtained from the ink of cuttlefish and other cephalopods.
Shift (a change, also associated with garments when referring to adjusting clothing)
Mound - An elevated mass of earth, often formed naturally or by human activity
Garnet - An orange-red colored variety of the mineral garnet, often used as a semi-precious stone or jewelry material.
Emus - Large, black and white, native to Australia, unable to fly long distances or in the air.
